<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

In a CephCluster with OSD configured using StorageClassDeviceSets, the osd-prepare jobs do not get scheduled. This is preventing the osds from starting, and from the cephcluster coming up.

**Expected behavior:**

The pods should get scheduled and started, to allow actual osd pods to start and the cluster to come up.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

This was hit when testing OCS with the rook/ceph:v1.0.0-549.g4847430.dirty image.
The osd-prepare pods have a NodeSelector set based on the StorageClassDeviceSet name, which prevents them from being scheduled on any node.

For example,

```console
$ oc describe po rook-ceph-osd-prepare-example-deviceset-0-nk92q-zqvxz
Name:               rook-ceph-osd-prepare-example-deviceset-0-nk92q-zqvxz
Namespace:          openshift-storage
Priority:           0
PriorityClassName:  <none>
Node:               <none>
Labels:             app=rook-ceph-osd-prepare
                    ceph.rook.io/pvc=example-deviceset-0-nk92q
                    controller-uid=a049de60-ca47-11e9-bf08-0ee14f551810
                    job-name=rook-ceph-osd-prepare-example-deviceset-0-nk92q
                    rook_cluster=openshift-storage
Annotations:        openshift.io/scc: rook-ceph
Status:             Pending
IP:                
Controlled By:      Job/rook-ceph-osd-prepare-example-deviceset-0-nk92q
Init Containers:
  blkdevmapper:
    Image:      ceph/ceph:v14.2.2-20190722
    Port:       <none>
    Host Port:  <none>
    Args:
      cp
      -a
      /example-deviceset-0-nk92q
      /mnt/example-deviceset-0-nk92q
    Environment:  <none>
    Mounts:
      /mnt from example-deviceset-0-nk92q-bridge (rw)
      /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from rook-ceph-osd-token-ftl6h (ro)
    Devices:
      /example-deviceset-0-nk92q from example-deviceset-0-nk92q
Containers:
  copy-bins:
    Image:      rook/ceph:master
    Port:       <none>
    Host Port:  <none>
    Args:
      copy-binaries
      --copy-to-dir
      /rook
    Environment:  <none>
    Mounts:
      /rook from rook-binaries (rw)
      /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from rook-ceph-osd-token-ftl6h (ro)
  provision:
    Image:      ceph/ceph:v14.2.2-20190722
    Port:       <none>
    Host Port:  <none>
    Command:
      /rook/tini
    Args:
      --
      /rook/rook
      ceph
      osd
      provision
    Environment:
      ROOK_NODE_NAME:             example-deviceset-0-nk92q
      ROOK_CLUSTER_ID:            cd23bb4d-ca46-11e9-bf08-0ee14f551810
      ROOK_PRIVATE_IP:             (v1:status.podIP)
      ROOK_PUBLIC_IP:              (v1:status.podIP)
      ROOK_CLUSTER_NAME:          openshift-storage
      ROOK_MON_ENDPOINTS:         <set to the key 'data' of config map 'rook-ceph-mon-endpoints'>  Optional: false
      ROOK_MON_SECRET:            <set to the key 'mon-secret' in secret 'rook-ceph-mon'>          Optional: false
      ROOK_ADMIN_SECRET:          <set to the key 'admin-secret' in secret 'rook-ceph-mon'>        Optional: false
      ROOK_CONFIG_DIR:            /var/lib/rook
      ROOK_CEPH_CONFIG_OVERRIDE:  /etc/rook/config/override.conf
      ROOK_FSID:                  <set to the key 'fsid' in secret 'rook-ceph-mon'>  Optional: false
      ROOK_DATA_DEVICES:          /mnt/example-deviceset-0-nk92q
      ROOK_PVC_BACKED_OSD:        true
    Mounts:
      /etc/ceph from ceph-default-config-dir (rw)
      /mnt from example-deviceset-0-nk92q-bridge (rw)
      /rook from rook-binaries (rw)
      /var/lib/rook from rook-data (rw)
      /var/log/ceph from rook-ceph-log (rw)
      /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount from rook-ceph-osd-token-ftl6h (ro)
Conditions:
  Type           Status
  PodScheduled   False
Volumes:
  rook-data:
    Type:          HostPath (bare host directory volume)
    Path:          /var/lib/rook
    HostPathType:  
  ceph-default-config-dir:
    Type:    EmptyDir (a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime)
    Medium:  
  rook-config-override:
    Type:      ConfigMap (a volume populated by a ConfigMap)
    Name:      rook-config-override
    Optional:  false
  rook-ceph-log:
    Type:          HostPath (bare host directory volume)
    Path:          /var/lib/rook/log/openshift-storage
    HostPathType:  
  rook-binaries:
    Type:    EmptyDir (a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime)
    Medium:  
  example-deviceset-0-nk92q:
    Type:       PersistentVolumeClaim (a reference to a PersistentVolumeClaim in the same namespace)
    ClaimName:  example-deviceset-0-nk92q
    ReadOnly:   false
  example-deviceset-0-nk92q-bridge:
    Type:    EmptyDir (a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime)
    Medium:  Memory
  rook-ceph-osd-token-ftl6h:
    Type:        Secret (a volume populated by a Secret)
    SecretName:  rook-ceph-osd-token-ftl6h
    Optional:    false
QoS Class:       BestEffort
Node-Selectors:  kubernetes.io/hostname=example-deviceset-0-nk92q
Tolerations:     node.kubernetes.io/not-ready:NoExecute for 300s
                 node.kubernetes.io/unreachable:NoExecute for 300s
Events:
  Type     Reason            Age                 From               Message
  ----     ------            ----                ----               -------
  Warning  FailedScheduling  46s (x24 over 33m)  default-scheduler  0/6 nodes are available: 6 node(s) didn't match node selector.
```


**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).
